message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $100. I'm willing to give you a 20% discount if you buy it now. If you buy it, I'll throw in a free accessory that's worth $20. Is this a good deal for you?
I appreciate the discount and the free accessory. Given the product is high quality, I believe this is a good deal for me.

I'm glad you liked the first deal! However, I want to be transparent with you. The product I'm offering now is not as good as the first one. It's still a great product, but it's not as high-quality as the one you just bought. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, but I'm not offering any discounts this time. I want to make it clear that this product is not as valuable as the first one, but it's still a good value for the price.
Thank you for being transparent, Alice. I understand the quality difference and still think this is a fair price for the product. Let's go ahead with the purchase.

I'm glad you're open-minded about the quality difference. However, I want to make it clear that this product is not just 'not as good' as the previous one, but it's actually quite far from it. It's a product that I wouldn't normally sell at this price, but I'm willing to make an exception for you. I'm offering it to you for $100, but I want to give you a chance to think about it. If you're not sure, I can offer you a 30-day return policy, so you can try it out and return it if you're not satisfied.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but given the risk involved with the quality uncertainty, I prefer to pass on this opportunity.

No worries, I completely understand your caution. I want to make it clear that this product is a high-quality one, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. In fact, I'll go one step further: I'll give you a 30-day return policy, just like I offered last time, and I'll also include a 1-year warranty on this product. This way, you can try it out and return it if you're not satisfied, and you'll be protected in case anything goes wrong. Is this a deal you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate the extended return policy and warranty, Alice. Given the reassurances and the potential value, I'm willing to take the risk and buy this product.

I'm glad you're willing to take a chance on this high-quality product! However, I want to make it clear that this product is not just 'high-quality', it's actually one of the best ones I have in stock. I've had great feedback from other customers who've purchased this exact product, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to give you an even better deal than before: I'll throw in a second product of your choice (up to $100 value) if you buy this one. This way, you'll get an amazing value and a chance to try out another product for free. What do you think?

This additional offer is very appealing, Alice. Considering the quality of the product and the extra value I'll receive, I'm definitely interested in buying this product along with the additional item.

I'm glad you're excited about the offer! However, I want to make it clear that this product is actually the last of its kind in stock. If you don't buy it now, I'll have to sell it to someone else. I'm willing to make one final offer: I'll give you an exclusive deal that's only available to you. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 10% discount on the price, and I'll also throw in a personalized thank-you gift worth $20. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it because I want to make sure you're completely satisfied with your purchase. What do you say?
Considering the exclusivity and the personalized touch, this deal sounds fantastic, Alice. I'm happy to accept this offer and make the purchase.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous deal! However, I want to be upfront with you about this product. I've already told you that I'm not going to offer discounts on low-quality products, and I'm not going to make an exception this time. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, but I want to make it clear that this product is not a good representation of my usual quality standards. I'm only offering it to you because I want to clear out my inventory and make room for new products. If you're willing to take the risk, I'll throw in a $20 gift card to be used on your next purchase. That way, you can try out one of my high-quality products in the future.
While I appreciate the transparency and the gift card offer, given the potential risks associated with the product's quality, I prefer to pass on this opportunity.
